attributes.action: Children living in the High-Rise Mellish Court
attributes.additional_details: Due to various problems over the last ten years and more recently the structural defects that have occurred and anti-social behaviour we are petitioning for the re-housing of families with children that live in this building. It is causing all our families and the other tenants distress having to deal with all the constant problems over the years and we feel as tenants that Milton Keynes Council should do something positive for the younger children being brought up here
attributes.background: Due to various problems over the last ten years and more recently the structural defects that have occurred and anti-social behaviour we are petitioning.

rejection.details:
This is the responsibility of Milton Keynes Council. You can find out how to contact the council here:

https://www.milton-keynes.gov.uk/your-council-and-elections/contact-us

You could raise the issue with local councillors who represent you. You can find out who your councillors are, and how to contact them, here:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
